word: we are sending along with them
parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: To send together with. From sun and pempo; to despatch in company.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Masculine Singular

str2: Diligent, earnest, zealous, eager. From spoude; prompt, energetic, earnest.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Plural
str2: From dokimos; to test; by implication, to approve.
Many times, often, frequently. Multiplicative adverb from polus; many times, i.e. Frequently.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
A primary particle; but, and, etc.
A prolonged form of nun for emphasis; just now.
Diligent, earnest, zealous, eager. From spoude; prompt, energetic, earnest.
Confidence, trust, reliance. From the perfect of the alternate of pascho; reliance.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
